alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Johnson; Louisa; Muscatine; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 07 at 5:27PM CDT until May 07 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN LOUISA...SOUTHWESTERN CEDAR...JOHNSON...NORTHEASTERN WASHINGTON AND MUSCATINE COUNTIES... At 527 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Solon to near Hills Access, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... River Junction around 530 PM CDT. Lone Tree, Sutliff, Morse and Elmira around 535 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include West Liberty, Nichols, Cedar Bluff, Oasis, Muscatine County Fairgrounds, West Branch, Conesville, Buchanan, Herbert Hoover National Historic Site, Cedar Valley, Cedar Valley Park, Cedar County Fairgrounds, Saulsbury Bridge Campground, Springdale, Cranston, Tipton, Rochester, Tipton Matthews Airport, Ardon, Muscatine Municipal Airport, Fruitland and Muscatine. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: These storms are producing destructive winds and large damaging hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
